oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1949-11-26 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry show from November 26, 1949. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Red Foley (host, performer), Hank Williams (performer), Jimmy Riddle (performer), Rod Brasfield (performer), Helen Harris (performer), Little Jimmy Dickens (performer), Minnie Pearl (performer), and Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys (performer). Transcribed from Titania-Palast, Berlin, Germany. Part 2: http://cmfdigitization.cmf.int:2011/cdm/ref/collection/musicaudio/id/619
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Red Foley; Hank Williams; Jimmy Riddle; Rod Brasfield; Helen Harris; Little Jimmy Dickens
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Cavalier Cigarettes commercial -- Opening statement (Grant Turner) -- Freight Train Boogie (Red Foley) -- Opening statement (Red Foley) -- Move It On Over (Hank Williams) -- Prince Albert commercial (Red Foley, Grant Turner) -- [Unidentified harmonica tune] (Jimmy Riddle harmonica) -- Red Foley introduces Rod Brasfield -- Comedy routine (Rod Brasfield, Red Foley) -- Red Foley introduces Helen Harris -- He Taught Me To Yodel (Helen Harris) -- Red Foley introduces Little Jimmy Dickens -- Country Boy (Little Jimmy Dickens)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Titania-Palast (Berlin, Germany); Turner, Grant; Foley, Red, 1910-1968; Williams, Hank, 1923-1953; Riddle, Jimmy, 1918-1982; Brasfield, Rod; Harris, Helen (Singer); Dickens, Little Jimmy, 1920-; Minnie Pearl; Acuff, Roy; Smoky Mountain Boys
